name: Xeranthemum
description: Xeranthemum is a genus of 6 species of annuals in the family Asteraceae, native to the Mediterranean and southwestern Asia.The members of this genus are known for their silvery foliage and colorful, daisy-like, papery flowers. They have alternate, undivided leaves and compact heads of small florets on long stalks. They are great cut flowers and are suited to both formal and modern style arrangements.
meaning: The name “Xeranthemum” is derived from the Greek words “xeros” (“dry”) and “anthemon” (“flower”).
color_description: These flowers come in shades of pink, purple and white.
